messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] plenty and contentment (was controlled kids, mean...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/12/2004 12:19:58 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... *anything* my little heart desired.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/12/2004 12:19:58 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
>>>>>><< Sandra was obviously deprived, and often. I could have
*anything* my little heart desired.

<though, I'm a *happy* shopper! <g> >>

OBVIOUSLY deprived?
I'm seeming needy to you? Really? Kelly, why would you SAY that? Tell
me!<<<<<<<

Well, *obviously* from your posts of your childhood.

NOT neediness! <g>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] plenty and contentment (was controlled kids, mean...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/12/2004 12:19:58 PM Eastern Standard Time, SandraDodd@aol.com writes: Because Kelly who wasn t poor doesn t like it, and I (poor me) who
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/12/2004 12:19:58 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
Because Kelly who wasn't poor doesn't like it, and I (poor me) who was poor
doesn't either, it's possible that anyone's children might not think it's fun
either, for whatever personal reasons those might be.

But it does seem to me that it has to do with freedom and choice. Choosing
not to buy is in a different emotional category from the inability to buy.<<<<


Yep.

~Kelly
